name: Marble-leafed Jewel Orchid
description: Dossinia marmorata, commonly known as Marble-leafed Jewel Orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Borneo, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (15-30 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive intricate vein patterns that resemble precious metalwork and marble. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest to any environment. It's extremely popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive marbled foliage.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
